comments.commentBody: In my opinion, Atlanta's sprawl is due to local governments who rather do their own thing and do not believe in collaboration or cooperation. Lax zoning laws also play a significant role. And cheap gas. If it were up to me, I would increase gas tax significantly and funnel the additional funds into public transit. If people paid all the externalities associated with long milage commutes, then perhaps people would live closer to where they worked.

We also have wonderful wars, which need to be paid for. Some people think we should be invading Syria and Iran, but they expect someone else to fight the battles and die.

Maybe we should trade fighting wars for fighting disease and to "promote the general welfare," in other words what those socialist Founding Fathers mentioned.
Um...the little boy in Africa is not a future king of Great Britain?
A baby boy was born in a village somewhere in Africa today. Why no headlines and gushing American well-wishers for him?
Congratulations to Will & Kate!  May i suggest the name Philip, not for the baby's great grandfather but for Phil Mickelson and his great British Open win!

1. "When she was asked what had become of the stolen art, she stuttered and then denied that any burning of artwork had occurred."
2. "Radu Catalin Dancu, Mrs. Dogaru’s lawyer, said...it was unclear what had become of the stolen works. “We might never find out what happened to the paintings,” he said."
Let her remain in jail until she says what she did with the paintings, even if she does not know exactly where they are now.

You didn't miss anything.
I'm with you---how about a follow up to her denial that any burning of artwork had occurred--which is assuredly NOT an answer to the question of what had become of the stolen art"--- with CONTINUING queries of "what had become of the stolen art" until she either gives an answer that makes sense or says she doesn't know. Unfortunately since she's stuck on the "no burning of the artwork had occurred" , I'm guessing that's exactly what happened and she's stuck and unable to dissemble any further.
When reading stories like this don't you find yourself talking to the page suggesting the no-brainer questions to ask?! Or at least giving some explanation as to why the questions aren't asked.

So where's the art?

Did I miss it, or did the story not even suggest that the mom wasn't asked, so where is the art? Even if that issue was not raised, would've been nice to know.
A Real news for royal family .

The death of the schoolchildren in India who ate the poisoned school lunches is a great tragedy.
Sometimes it seems that all the news is sad.
Cannot you allow that it is nice to have some good news for a change?
A new babe is here, mom and baby doing well.
This is an occasion for happiness.

The royal birth makes for great headlines about the privileged class.  I guess the death of 25 starving children eating poisoned food in India is "old news".  It is a bonus beloning to the "privileged class" !  You never want for anything.

Great that you have given this trivial event little coverage.

I am proud of you, and ashamed of all the rest.
Somehow, I think the "masses"..(meaning anyone you look down upon apparently) are able to read about the royal birth and move on to other stories. A little less arrogance might be nice.

This so called news should be published in the "who cares" section (which I hope the NYT will start soon). In this new section, we should find all we need to know (or actually don't need to know at all) about rich people giving birth to rich babies, talentless people doing talentless things, etc etc. Funny how little has changed: in the Roman Empire they gave masses circus to take their minds off real issues; now they give us royal babies and celebrities.
Actually, primogeniture is still alive and well. It's succession that's changed.

Shielding one's child and destroying the stolen goods are two different things. Whatever her first instincts were as a mother, if she burned the paintings she knew what she was doing. As for calling the cops on your child or family member, that might depend on how you viewed the crime and what the conditions of punishment might be.

In Baltimore, a mother helped her son dispose of the body of the young girl he had murdered--a neighbor, no less. The young man's mother also apparently expressed condolences to the mother of the murdered girl.

Parents will do very strange things--shielding a murderer not being on the same scale as burning paintings, if she did so.

But, I'm with Sarah, many moms and family members would turn in their children or encourage them to do so themselves. After all, it was the Unabomber's brother who put the FBI onto his brother.
Remind me again who was in office in the late Summer/early Fall of 2008?
The average first time labor is 24 hours. The latent phase (from 1-4 cm) can take 16 hours alone. So 14 isn't too shabby.

I guess your take-away is that a lot of women shouldn't have gotten pregnant in the first place. And you'd be right. Pity that birth-control kiosks aren't the first things established when western countries visit the Third World.

There will be Queens abc, I think that even though they say otherwise Camilla will be Queen ( as the wife of an anointed king it will be her right) Then when William becomes King his wife Catherine Duchess of Cambridge will stop being a commoner and become an anointed queen alongside her husband. They will be Queens but they will not be Sovereigns
Brian, just as Prince Phillip is not the king by right of being married to the queen, Camilla will not be called the queen.

Sandra, Camilla would be Queen Consort, since she comes to the throne by right of marriage rather than birth. Just as the current monarch's mother was a queen and the spouses of George V and Edward VII were queens, but Victoria's husband was - Prince Albert.
Only kings for the next 3 generations...a bit disappointed there is no new queen in sight...but the birth of a healthy baby is always a celebration!

Chuckles has been right on organic food, architecture and which direction the world should be going.  I suspect, he could, as King, be even as good as the surprising Edward.  Sadly, however,  he comes without the ornamentation of Lily Langree and Sarah Bernhardt and Churchill's mother and... yes, in the old days it was good to be the king, but what's it going to be like by the time this unnamed urchin assumes the throne?  Ermine amid ashes at the rate the earth is warming.  Born on the hottest day in seven years is not auspicious...

For everyone who thinks that the British monarchy is just a harmless tourist trap and that it causes no harm, I recommend you look into the latest attempts by Prince Charles to convince the UK National Health Service on the merits of homeopathy. When you give respect and deference to people on the basis of nothing other than their lineage, then this type of thing is going to happen. People in power should be able to be held accountable, not to have judges rule that their lobbying attempts should be kept secret. And the mass celebration of this baby (for whom I have no ill will) perpetuates the continuance of aristocratic privileges across the world. The birth of this baby should be a happy event for family and friends, but nobody else.
71 million a year for federer's endorsement... I find that hard to believe... what's your source?

to frankly,

I cited Forbes as my source. See brackets. Go to Forbes, enter Roger Federer's name, and there you'll see the $71million yearly. I was feeling kind of droopy about his performance at Wimbledon, but I guess he has enough pelf to keep himself diverted from problems on the court.

The kid a leech? Think of it this way: lots of businesses have bought sponsorship in him. Did you know that Roger Federer gets $71,000,000 a year from various sponsors eager to affix his face/body to advertisements for their watches, champagne, and airlines?[Forbes]  I'm sure the Kiddie King is worth a whole lot more than $71,000,000 a year to a whole country of sponsors.
That's what Argentina thinks.
You are wrong gentlebob. These are not colonies: they are independent nations, all members of the UN. "Sauce and beverage names"??? Get real. Besides, the UK has no colonies now.
Fear not. You'll get over it.
But you can look at the DVD starring Helen Mirren as often as you like.
My whole life I have only known a female monarch in Britain.  It makes me sad that I will likely not know another queen in the British monarchy for the rest of my life.

There are so many negative comments saying, there are lots of other babies born! But the commenters never seem to want to celebrate those other babies, only rebuke those who celebrate this one. Rick, you are right that there are lots of baby boys -- so, be happy for those families, rather than criticizing those giving good wishes today.

You are being sarcastic, no?

I am a midwife and I would like to remind you that labour takes a while...it is an arduous task, and 14 hours is just about right for a normal and straightforward vaginal delivery. It certainly seems to me that she has had an excellent course of pregnancy and has given birth well, and to a healthy son. It is what we should hope and expect for all women.

They both have college degrees. He has military training and is a rescue pilot. And I'm sure Kate grew up expecting to work in her adulthood, as her parents did before her. I imagine they are both quite busy.

Brian,
You are correct. I meant Edward VII (Seventh). A show was aired this week in America about David. There was wonderful film footage, mostly from the 1930s, showing David (Edward VIII) and Wallis Simpson. Both brothers were quite handsome. I understand Bertie was also reluctant to be King. Of course, he stuttered. So, fate took a hand with the arrival of Mrs. Simpson.

8:05 a.m.

Ellen,
I think you meant Edward VII, Victoria's eldest son when he was Prince of Wales, As for David who became Edward VIII his father George V always maintained that Bertie would be the better king and so it was; Bertie Duke of York became George VI. a good man and a respected King of England

I was raised in the LDS Church. From day one my parents and my church leaders always taught me that I needed to study the scriptures and gain a testimony of my own.  They taught me that through study and prayer the Holy Spirit would teach me truth.  I can tell you that I recieved an answer from God through his holy spirit that the Book of Mormon is exactly what it professes to be; Another Testament of Jesus Christ. I have always known that Joseph Smith was a polygamist.  I also know that Abraham was a polygamist.  At the end of the day, it doesn't matter to me whether Joseph Smith was commissioned by God to practice polygamy or if he was a rogue prophet.  I worship Jesus Christ. What matters to me is that I know intellectually and spiritually that Joseph Smith translated the Book of Mormon through the power of God.  All you who denigrate Mormons as ignorant or quick to accept what someone tells them are just fooling yourselves. Mormons are taught to read and ponder from day one in the church.  Mormons sacrifice their time, money, and their energy to God and to serving others, not because someone told them lies, but because someone told them truths. That blessings of love, joy, and happiness come to those who follow God's teachings. Those teachings are found in The Book of Mormon.  I spent 8 years studying science in college.  I know about experiments.  The intellectuall reasoning behind my faith, derives from a series of spiritual experiments I conducted. Observe the results

Suejean:

Sounds like you guys were pawns in the Navy's chess game!
Make that *prawns*...

It sure felt like it, Een.  Although the last Port Angeles move was because our landlord decided to sell the house we were renting just a few weeks before our next Navy move, so couldn't blame the Navy for that one.

It was a fine puzzle, ut toughert than many Tuesdays. Still i got it with no reveals and without my crutch Ms. Check. It did make me want to go to the beach, which I'm doing next month. I'm taking some of my grandchildren whale watching. I'm excited to see their reactions. We'll spend a week or so on the Olympic Peninsula in my motorhome. I'm excited about the trip.

I'd move to the peninsula if not for my kids and grandkids being local. I love the weather in Sequim ( pronounced squim). Not too hot, nor too cold.

Enjoyed this tougher than normal puzzle. Well done.
